sen.j: 平等院（びょうどういん）は、京都府宇治市にある藤原氏ゆかりの寺院。
sen.e: Byodo-in Temple a temple connected to the Fujiwara clan located in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Byodo-in Temple is a temple connected to the Fujiwara clan located in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Byodo-in Temple is a temple connected to the Fujiwara clan located in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 平安時代後期・11世紀の建築、仏像、絵画、庭園などを今日に伝え、「古都京都の文化財」の一部として世界遺産に登録されている。
sen.e: The architecture, Buddhist imagery, paintings and gardens date from the latter part of the Heian period and the temple has been designated a UNESCO World Heratige Site as one of the 'Historic Monuments of Ancient Kyoto'.

The architecture, Buddhist imagery, paintings and gardens date from the latter part of the Heian period in the 11th century and the temple has been designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site as one of the 'Historic Monuments of Ancient Kyoto.'
sen.cmt: in the 11th centuryを補足。Heratige→Heritageピリオドを移動。
sen.e: The architecture, Buddhist imagery, paintings and gardens date from the latter part of the Heian period in the 11th century and the temple has been designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site as one of the 'Historic Monuments of Ancient Kyoto.'

sen.j: 山号を朝日山と称する。
sen.e: Its honorific mountain prefix is 'Asahisan'.
Its honorific mountain prefix is 'Asahisan.'
Its honorific mountain prefix is 'Asahisan.'

sen.j: 宗派は17世紀以来浄土宗と天台宗を兼ね、現在は特定の宗派に属さない単立の仏教寺院となっている。
sen.e: It had been devoted to both the Pure Land Sect and Tendai Sect since the 17th century but is now independent and not affiliated with any particular Buddhist sect.
sen.cmt: ・Pure Land Sect: 新和英大辞典・Tendai Sect: 新和英大辞典・particular sect: 新和英大辞典・independent: 新和英大辞典
sen.e: It had been devoted to both the Pure Land Sect and Tendai Sect since the 17th century but is now independent and not affiliated with any particular Buddhist sect.
It had been devoted to both Jodo Sect and Tendai Sect since the 17th century but is now independent and not affiliated with any particular Buddhist sect.
sen.cmt: 浄土宗を他のファイルの表現に合わせ、「Jodo Sect」としました。

sen.j: 本尊は阿弥陀如来、開基は藤原頼通、開山は明尊である。
sen.e: It was founded by Kaiki (founding patron), FUJIWARA no Yorimichi and Kaizan (founding priest), Myoson and dedicated to the principal image, Amitabha.
sen.cmt: 原文の「開山」を「開基」に訂正
sen.e: It was founded by Kaiki (founding patron), FUJIWARA no Yorimichi and Kaisan (founding priest), Myoson and dedicated to the principal image, Amitabha.
sen.cmt: Kaisanに訂正。※デジタル大辞泉その他の辞書によるとかいさん、となっている。サイトによってはかいざん、としている場合もある。
sen.e: It was founded by Kaiki (founding patron), FUJIWARA no Yorimichi and Kaisan (founding priest), Myoson and dedicated to the principal image, Amitabha.

sen.j: 平等院の創建
sen.e: The Founding of Byodo-in Temple
The Founding of Byodo-in Temple
The Founding of Byodo-in Temple

sen.j: 京都南郊の宇治の地は、『源氏物語』の「宇治十帖」の舞台であり、平安時代初期から貴族の別荘が営まれていた。
sen.e: The Uji area to the south of Kyoto is the setting for the 'Uji Jujyo' (10 Uji chapters) of the "The Tale of Genji" and had been a place where nobility constructed their villas since the early Heian period.
sen.cmt: ・"The Tale of Genji": 新和英大辞典
sen.e: The Uji area to the south of Kyoto is the setting for the 'Uji Jujyo' (10 Uji chapters) of the "The Tale of Genji" and had been a place where nobility constructed their villas since the early Heian period.

The Uji area to the south of Kyoto is the setting for the 'Uji Jujo' (10 Uji chapters) of the "The Tale of Genji" and had been a place where nobility constructed their villas since the early Heian period.

sen.j: 現在の平等院の地は、9世紀末頃、光源氏のモデルとも言われる左大臣である嵯峨源氏の源融（みなもと の とおる）が営んだ別荘だったものが宇多天皇に渡り、天皇の孫である源重信を経て長徳4年（998年）、摂政藤原道長の別荘「宇治殿」となったものである。
sen.e: The current location of Byodo-in Temple is where Minister of the Left, MINAMOTO no Toru of Saga Genji, who is said to have been the model for Hikaru Genji, built his villa at the end of the 9th century, which was then passed on to Emperor Uda who gave it to his grandson MINAMOTO no Shigenobu before it became the Uji-den villa of Regent FUJIWARA no Michinaga.
sen.cmt: ・Hikaru Genji: 英辞郎 on the WEB・Minister of the Left: 新和英大辞典・Regent: 新和英大辞典
sen.e: The current location of Byodo-in Temple is where the Minister of the Left, MINAMOTO no Toru of Saga Genji, who is said to have been the model for Hikaru Genji, built his villa at the end of the 9th century, which was then passed on to Emperor Uda who gave it to his grandson MINAMOTO no Shigenobu before it became the Uji-den villa of Regent FUJIWARA no Michinaga in 998.

The current location of Byodo-in Temple is where the Sadaijin (Minister of the Left), MINAMOTO no Toru of Saga Genji, who is said to have been the model for Hikaru Genji, built his villa at the end of the 9th century, which was then passed on to Emperor Uda who gave it to his grandson MINAMOTO no Shigenobu before it became the Uji-den villa of Regent FUJIWARA no Michinaga in 998.
sen.cmt: "Minister of the Left"→"Sadaijin (Minister of the Left)"に変更しました。

sen.j: 道長は万寿4年（1027年）没し、その子の関白藤原頼通は永承7年（1052年）、宇治殿を寺に改めた。
sen.e: Michinaga passed away in 1027 and his son, Chancellor FUJIWARA no Yorimichi converted Uji-den into a Buddhist temple in 1052.
Michinaga passed away in 1027 and his son, Chancellor FUJIWARA no Yorimichi converted Uji-den into a Buddhist temple in 1052.
Michinaga passed away in 1027 and his son, Chancellor FUJIWARA no Yorimichi converted Uji-den into a Buddhist temple in 1052.

sen.j: これが平等院の始まりである。
sen.e: This was the origin of Byodo-in Temple.
This was the origin of Byodo-in Temple.
This was the origin of Byodo-in Temple.

sen.j: 開山（初代執印）は小野道風の孫にあたり、園城寺長吏を務めた明尊である。
sen.e: The Kaizan (first priest) was Myoson, grandson of ONO no Tofu and Chori (chief priest) of Onjyo-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: ・ONO no Tofu: http://www.biwako-visitors.jp/search/spot_around_155.html・Chori (chief priest) of Onjyo-ji Temple: http://jp.encarta.msn.com/encyclopedia_1161537182/content.html、http://kotobank.jp/word/%E6%98%8E%E5%B0%8A
sen.e: The Kaisan (first priest) was Myoson, grandson of ONO no Tofu and Chori (chief priest) of Onjyo-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: Kaisanに訂正。※デジタル大辞泉その他の辞書によるとかいさん、となっている。サイトによってはかいざん、としている場合もある。
sen.e: The Kaisan (first priest) was Myoson, grandson of ONO no Tofu and Chori (chief priest) of Onjo-ji Temple.

sen.j: 創建時の本堂は、鳳凰堂の北方、宇治川の岸辺近くにあり大日如来を本尊としていたが、翌天喜元年（1053）には、西方極楽浄土をこの世に出現させたような阿弥陀堂（現・鳳凰堂）が建立された。
sen.e: At the time of its founding, the main hall stood near the bank of Uji-gawa River, north of the Ho-o-do hall, and housed the principal image of Vairocana, but in 1053 the Amitabha hall (present Ho-o-do hall) was constructed as an earthly representation of the Western Pure Land Paradise.
sen.cmt: ・an Amitabha hall (present Ho-o-do): 新和英大辞典
sen.e: At the time of its founding, the main hall stood near the bank of Uji-gawa River, north of the Ho-o-do hall, and housed the principal image of Vairocana, but in 1053 the Amitabha hall (present Ho-o-do hall) was constructed as an earthly representation of the Western Pure Land Paradise.

At the time of its founding, the main hall stood near the bank of the Uji-gawa River, north of the Ho-o-do hall, and housed the principal image of Vairocana, but in 1053 the Amitabha hall (present Ho-o-do hall) was constructed as an earthly representation of the Western Pure Land Paradise.
sen.cmt: "Uji-gawa River"→"the Uji-gawa River"に変更しました。

sen.j: 平安時代後期、日本では「末法思想」が広く信じられていた。
sen.e: In the latter part of the Heian period, the 'Third Age of Buddhism' theory became widely believed in Japan.
In the latter part of the Heian period, the 'Third Age of Buddhism' theory became widely believed in Japan.
In the latter part of the Heian period, the 'Third Age of Buddhism' theory became widely believed in Japan.

sen.j: 釈尊の入滅（一般で言う「死去」）から2,000年目以降は、仏法がすたれ、天災人災が続き、世の中は乱れるとする思想である。
sen.e: This is the theory that Buddhism would decline, natural and man-made disasters would continue and the world would be plunged into chaos 2,000 years after Sakyamuni Buddha's passing into Nirvana (death).

This is the theory that Buddhism would decline, natural and man-made disasters would continue and the world would be plunged into chaos 2,000 years after Sakyamuni Buddha's passing into Nirvana (death).

This is the theory that Buddhism would decline, natural and man-made disasters would continue and the world would be plunged into chaos 2,000 years after Sakyamuni Buddha's passing into Nirvana (death).

sen.j: 平等院が創建された永承7年（1052年）は、当時の思想ではまさに「末法」の元年に当たっており、当時の貴族は極楽往生を願い、西方極楽浄土の教主とされる阿弥陀如来を祀る仏堂を盛んに造営した。
sen.e: The thinking at the time of Byodo-in Temple's founding in 1052 coincided with the first year of the Third Age and members of the noble classes prayed to be reborn in paradise and built numerous Buddha halls devoted to Western Pure Land Paradise overseer, Amitabha.

The thinking at the time of Byodo-in Temple's founding in 1052 coincided with the first year of the 'Third Age of Buddhism' and members of the noble classes prayed to be reborn in paradise and built numerous Buddha halls devoted to Western Pure Land Paradise overseer, Amitabha.

The thinking at the time of Byodo-in Temple's founding in 1052 coincided with the first year of the 'Third Age of Buddhism' and members of the noble classes prayed to be reborn in paradise and built numerous Buddha halls devoted to Western Pure Land Paradise overseer, Amitabha.

sen.j: 平安時代後期の京都では、平等院以外にも皇族・貴族による大規模寺院の建設が相次いでいた。
sen.e: In addition to Byodo-in Temple, the Imperial family and nobility successively built many large temples in Kyoto during the latter part of the Heian period.
In addition to Byodo-in Temple, the Imperial family and nobility successively built many large temples in Kyoto during the latter part of the Heian period.
In addition to Byodo-in Temple, the Imperial family and nobility successively built many large temples in Kyoto during the latter part of the Heian period.

sen.j: 藤原道長は寛仁4年（1020年）、無量寿院（のちの法成寺）を建立、また11世紀後半から12世紀にかけては白河天皇勅願の法勝寺を筆頭に、尊勝寺、最勝寺、円勝寺、成勝寺、延勝寺のいわゆる「六勝寺」が今の京都市左京区岡崎あたりに相次いで建立された。
sen.e: In 1020, FUJIWARA no Michinaga constructed Muryoju-in Temple (later Hojo-ji Temple) and, from the second half of the 11th to the 12th century, the so-called 'Six Superiority Temples' Hosho-ji Temple, Sonsho-ji Temple, Saisho-ji Temple, Ensho-ji Temple, Seisho-ji Temple and Ensho-ji Temple were successively built at the order of Emperor Shirakawa in the area now known as Okazaki, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.

In 1020, FUJIWARA no Michinaga constructed Muryoju-in Temple (later Hojo-ji Temple) and, from the second half of the 11th to the 12th century, first Hossho-ji was built at Emperor Shirakawa's order, and the so-called 'Six Superiority Temples' Sonsho-ji Temple, Saisho-ji Temple, Ensho-ji Temple, Seisho-ji Temple and Ensho-ji Temple were successively built in the area now known as Okazaki, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 「白河天皇勅願の」は法勝寺 (Hossho-ji)のみに掛かる。first Hossho-ji was built at Emperor Shirakawa's orderを補足しましたが、問題があれば修正して下さい。
sen.e: In 1020, FUJIWARA no Michinaga constructed Muryoju-in Temple (later Hojo-ji Temple) and, from the second half of the 11th to the 12th century, first Hossho-ji was built at Emperor Shirakawa's order, and the so-called 'Six Superiority Temples' Sonsho-ji Temple, Saisho-ji Temple, Ensho-ji Temple, Seisho-ji Temple and Ensho-ji Temple were successively built in the area now known as Okazaki, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: しかし、歴史書に名をとどめるこれらの大伽藍も今は跡形もなく、平安時代の貴族が建立した寺院が建物、仏像、壁画、庭園まで含めて残存するという点で、平等院はかけがえのない存在となっている。
sen.e: However, not a trace remains of these once great temple complexes - which makes Byodo-in Temple, established by Heian period nobles and with its surviving architecture, Buddhist imagery, wall paintings and gardens irreplaceable.

However, not a trace remains of these once great temple complexes - which makes Byodo-in Temple, established by Heian period nobles and with its surviving architecture, Buddhist imagery, wall paintings and gardens irreplaceable.

However, not a trace remains of these once great temple complexes - a fact that makes Byodo-in Temple, established by Heian period nobles and with its surviving architecture, Buddhist imagery, wall paintings and gardens irreplaceable.
sen.cmt: 「かけがえのない存在になっている」の意味が出るように訳出し直しました。

sen.j: 平等院には、鳳凰堂以外にも以下のような堂塔が建ち並んでいた。
sen.e: In addition to Ho-o-do hall, Byodo-in Temple once included the following buildings.
In addition to Ho-o-do hall, Byodo-in Temple once included the following buildings.
In addition to Ho-o-do hall, Byodo-in Temple once included the following buildings.

sen.j: 法華堂－天喜4年（1056年）、頼通によって建立。
sen.e: Hokke-do hall: Constructed by Yorimichi in 1056.
Hokke-do hall: Constructed by Yorimichi in 1056.
Hokke-do hall: Constructed by Yorimichi in 1056.

sen.j: 今の平等院ミュージアム付近にあった。
sen.e: It stood in the area where Byodo-in Museum now stands.
It stood in the area where Byodo-in Museum now stands.
It stood in the area where Byodo-in Museum now stands.

sen.j: 多宝塔－康平4年（1061年）、頼通の娘の藤原寛子（かんし）によって建立。
sen.e: Two-storey pagoda: Constructed in 1061 by Yorimichi's daughter, FUJIWARA no Kanshi.
Two-storey pagoda: Constructed in 1061 by Yorimichi's daughter, FUJIWARA no Kanshi.
Two-storey pagoda: Constructed in 1061 by Yorimichi's daughter, FUJIWARA no Kanshi.

sen.j: 鳳凰堂の南東方向の宇治川べりにあった。
sen.e: Stood to the south of the Ho-o-do hall, by Uji-gawa River.
Stood to the southeast of the Ho-o-do hall, by Uji-gawa River.
Stood to the southeast of the Ho-o-do hall, by the Uji-gawa River.
sen.cmt: "Uji-gawa River"→"the Uji-gawa River"に変更しました。

sen.j: 五大堂－治暦2年（1066年）、右大臣藤原師実（頼通三男）によって建立。
sen.e: Godai-do hall: Constructed in 1066 by Minister of the Right, FUJIWARA no Morozane (third son of Yorimichi).
sen.cmt: ・Minister of the Right: 新和英大辞典
sen.e: Godai-do hall: Constructed in 1066 by the Minister of the Right, FUJIWARA no Morozane (third son of Yorimichi).
Godai-do hall: Constructed in 1066 by the Udaijin (Minister of the Right), FUJIWARA no Morozane (third son of Yorimichi).
sen.cmt: 統一用語リストどおりにアルファベット表記を追加。

sen.j: 鳳凰堂背後の浄土院付近にあった。
sen.e: Stood behind Ho-o-do hall, in the vicinity of Jodo-in Temple.
Stood behind Ho-o-do hall, in the vicinity of Jodo-in Temple.
Stood behind Ho-o-do hall, in the vicinity of Jodo-in Temple.

sen.j: 不動堂－延久5年（1073年）、右大臣源師房（頼通養子）によって建立。
sen.e: Fudo-do hall: Constructed in 1073 by Minister of the Right, MINAMOTO no Morofusa (Yorimichi's adopted son).
sen.cmt: ・Minister of the Right: 新和英大辞典
sen.e: Fudo-do hall: Constructed in 1073 by the Minister of the Right, MINAMOTO no Morofusa (Yorimichi's adopted son).
Fudo-do hall: Constructed in 1073 by the Udaijin (Minister of the Right), MINAMOTO no Morofusa (Yorimichi's adopted son).
sen.cmt: 統一用語リストどおりにアルファベット表記を追加。

sen.j: 鳳凰堂の南西方にあった。
sen.e: Stood to the southwest of Ho-o-do hall.
Stood to the southwest of Ho-o-do hall.
Stood to the southwest of Ho-o-do hall.

sen.j: 建武 (日本)3年（1336年）の楠木正成と足利氏の軍勢の戦いの兵火をはじめ、度重なる災害により上記の堂塔は廃絶し、鳳凰堂のみが奇跡的に災害をまぬがれて存続している。
sen.e: Beginning with a fire arising from the 1336 conflict between Masashige KUSUNOKI and the Ashikaga army, the above-mentioned buildings were all completely destroyed by numerous fires but the Ho-o-do hall has miraculously managed to avoid destruction.

Beginning with a fire arising from the 1336 conflict between Masashige KUSUNOKI and the Ashikaga army, the above-mentioned buildings were all completely destroyed by numerous fires but the Ho-o-do hall has miraculously managed to avoid destruction.

Beginning with a fire arising from the 1336 conflict between Masashige KUSUNOKI and the Ashikaga army, the above-mentioned buildings were all completely destroyed by numerous fires but the Ho-o-do hall has miraculously managed to avoid destruction.

sen.j: 現在の平等院
sen.e: Modern Byodo-in Temple
Modern Byodo-in Temple
Modern Byodo-in Temple

sen.j: 現在の平等院は、浄土宗の浄土院と、天台宗系の最勝院（ともに鳳凰堂の西側にある）という2つの寺院が共同で管理している。
sen.e: Byodo-in Temple is currently under the joint management of the Pure Land Sect Jodo-in Temple and the Tendai Sect Saisho-in Temple (both located to the west of the Ho-o hall).
Byodo-in Temple is currently under the joint management of the Pure Land Sect Jodo-in Temple and the Tendai Sect Saisho-in Temple (both located to the west of the Ho-o hall).
Byodo-in Temple is currently under the joint management of the Jodo Sect Jodo-in Temple and the Tendai Sect Saisho-in Temple (both located to the west of the Ho-o-do hall).
sen.cmt: 浄土宗＝Jodo Sect, 鳳凰堂＝Ho-o-do

sen.j: 浄土院は明応年間（1492－1501年）、最勝院は承応3年（1654年）の創始であり、平等院が浄土・天台両宗の共同管理となったのは、天和 (日本)元年（1681年）、寺社奉行の裁定によるものである。
sen.e: Jodo-in Temple was founded between 1492-1501, Saisho-in Temple as founded in 1654 and it was in 1681 that Byodo-in Temple came to be jointly managed by both the Pure Land and Tendai Sects following a ruling passed by the magistrate of shrines and temples.

Jodo-in Temple was founded between 1492-1501, Saisho-in Temple as founded in 1654 and it was in 1681 that Byodo-in Temple came to be jointly managed by both the Pure Land and Tendai Sects following a ruling passed by the magistrate of shrines and temples.

Jodo-in Temple was founded between 1492-1501, Saisho-in Temple was founded in 1654 and it was in 1681 that Byodo-in Temple came to be jointly managed by both the Jodo and Tendai Sects following a ruling passed by the magistrate of shrines and temples.

sen.j: 1990年代以降、庭園の発掘調査・復元、鳳凰堂堂内装飾のコンピュータ・グラフィックスによる再現などが行われている。
sen.e: Various projects including excavation of the gardens, restoration, and the computer graphical reproduction of the interior decoration of Ho-o-do hall have been taking place since the 1990s.
Various projects including excavation of the gardens, restoration, and the computer graphical reproduction of the interior decoration of Ho-o-do hall have been taking place since the 1990s.
Various projects including excavation of the gardens, restoration, and the computer graphical reproduction of the interior decoration of Ho-o-do hall have been taking place since the 1990s.

sen.j: 2001年にはそれまでの「宝物館」に代わり、「平等院鳳翔館」がオープンした。
sen.e: In 2001, the 'Byodo-in Temple Ho-sho-kan' was opened to replace the previous 'Homotsu-kan' (treasure hall).
In 2001, the 'Byodo-in Temple Ho-sho-kan' was opened to replace the previous 'Homotsu-kan' (treasure hall).
In 2001, the 'Byodo-in Temple Ho-sho-kan' was opened to replace the previous 'Homotsu-kan' (treasure hall).

sen.j: 建築家栗生明は、鳳翔館（新建築2001年9月号）の設計で、日本芸術院賞を受賞している。
sen.e: Architect Akira KURYU received an award from the Japan Art Academy for the design of the Ho-sho-kan (constructed in September 2001).
Architect Akira KURYU received an award from the Japan Art Academy for the design of the Ho-sho-kan ('Shinkenchiku' 2001 September issue).
sen.cmt: 新建築、は雑誌のタイトルのようです。
sen.e: Architect Akira KURYU received an award from the Japan Art Academy for the design of the Ho-sho-kan ('Shinkenchiku' 2001 September issue).

sen.j: 1996年から1997年にかけて、平等院の裏手に15階建てのマンションが建ち、鳳凰堂の背景になってしまっている。
sen.e: From 1996 to 1997, a 15-storey apartment block was constructed behind Byodo-in Temple and became the new backdrop to Ho-o-do hall.
From 1996 to 1997, a 15-storey apartment block was constructed behind Byodo-in Temple and became the new backdrop to Ho-o-do hall.
From 1996 to 1997, a 15-storey apartment block was constructed behind Byodo-in Temple and became the new backdrop to Ho-o-do hall.

sen.j: 創建当初からの風致が大きく損なわれたため、景観規制条例の強化の動きが出るなど、論議を呼んだ。
sen.e: The scenic beauty of the area has been greatly damaged since the time of the temple's founding, which has led to debates regarding the strengthening of landscape regulating ordinance.
sen.cmt: ・landscape regulating ordinance: 新英和大辞典
sen.e: The scenic beauty of the area has been greatly damaged since the time of the temple's founding, which has led to debates regarding the strengthening of landscape regulating ordinance.
The scenic beauty of the area that had been kept since the time of the temple's founding was greatly damaged, which has led to debates regarding the strengthening of landscape regulating ordinance.
sen.cmt: 「これまでに少しずつ損なわれてきた」のではなく、マンションが建った時点でそれまで保たれてきた景観が損なわれた」という意味だと思います。

sen.j: 鳳凰堂
sen.e: Ho-o-do Hall
Ho-o-do Hall
Ho-o-do Hall

sen.j: 天喜元年（1053年）の建立。
sen.e: Constructed in 1053.
Constructed in 1053.
Constructed in 1053.

sen.j: 浄土式庭園の阿字池の中島に東向きに建つ。
sen.e: Stands facing east on an island in Ajino-ike Pond in the Pure Land style garden.
Stands facing east on an island in Ajino-ike Pond in the Pure Land style garden.
Stands facing east on an island in Ajino-ike Pond in the Pure Land style garden.

sen.j: 本尊阿弥陀如来像を安置する中堂（ちゅうどう）、左右の翼廊、中堂背後の尾廊の計4棟が「平等院鳳凰堂」として国宝に指定されている。
sen.e: A total of four structures consisting of the central hall housing the principal image of Amitabha, the wing corridors on the left and right sides and the tail corridor have been designated National Treasures as 'Byodo-in Ho-o-do'.

A total of four structures consisting of the central hall housing the principal image of Amitabha, the wing corridors on the left and right sides and the tail corridor have been designated National Treasures as 'Byodo-in Ho-o-do'.

A total of four structures consisting of the central hall housing the principal image of Amitabha, the wing corridors on the left and right sides and the tail corridor have been designated National Treasures as 'Byodo-in Ho-o-do.'

sen.j: 中堂は入母屋造、裳階（もこし）付き。
sen.e: The central hall is topped by a hip-and-gable roof.
The central hall is topped by a hip-and-gable roof.
The central hall is topped by a hip-and-gable roof and also features a pent roof enclosure.
sen.cmt: 「裳階（もこし）付き」の部分を訳出しました。

sen.j: 東側正面中央の扉を開放すると、柱間の格子は本尊の頭部の高さに円窓が開けられており、建物外からも本尊阿弥陀如来の面相が拝せるようになっている。
sen.e: Opening the central door on the eastern side, the latticework in the bay has a circular window at the height of the principal image's head in order to allow the face of Amitabha to be worshipped from outside of the building.

Opening the central door on the eastern side, the latticework in the bay has a circular window at the height of the principal image's head in order to allow the face of Amitabha to be worshipped from outside of the building.

Opening the central door on the eastern side, the latticework in the bay has a circular window at the height of the principal image's head in order to allow the face of Amitabha to be worshipped from outside the building.
sen.cmt: 表現スタイル。 “ outside of the building.”=>” outside the building.”

sen.j: 阿弥陀如来の住する極楽浄土は西方にあると信じられており、池の東岸（あるいは寺の前を流れる宇治川の東岸）から、向かい岸（彼岸）の阿弥陀像を拝するように意図されたものである。
sen.e: It is believed that the Pure Land Paradise in which Amitabha resides lies in the west and, in order to reflect this, the building was constructed so that the statue of Amitabha can be seen on the opposite bank (a metaphor for nirvana) from pond's eastern bank (or the eastern bank of the Uji-gawa River that runs along the front of the temple).

It is believed that the Pure Land Paradise in which Amitabha resides lies in the west and, in order to reflect this, the building was constructed so that the statue of Amitabha can be seen on the opposite bank (a metaphor for nirvana) from pond's eastern bank (or the eastern bank of the Uji-gawa River that runs along the front of the temple).

It is believed that the Pure Land Paradise in which Amitabha resides lies in the west and, in order to reflect this, the building was constructed so that the statue of Amitabha can be seen on the opposite bank (a metaphor for nirvana) from pond's eastern bank (or the eastern bank of the Uji-gawa River that runs along the front of the temple).

sen.j: 中堂の屋根上には1対の鳳凰（想像上の鳥）像が据えられているが、現在屋根上にあるのは複製で、実物（国宝）は取り外して別途保管されている。
sen.e: The roof of the central hall is crowned with two statues of Chinese Phoenixes (a mythical bird), but these are reproductions with the originals (National Treasures) being deposited elsewhere.
The roof of the central hall is crowned with two statues of Chinese Phoenixes (a mythical bird), but these are reproductions with the originals (National Treasures) being deposited elsewhere.
The roof of the central hall is crowned with two statues of Chinese Phoenixes (a mythical bird), but these are reproductions with the originals (National Treasures) being deposited elsewhere.

sen.j: 本尊阿弥陀如来像（国宝）は仏師定朝の確証ある唯一の遺作。
sen.e: The Amitabha statue (National Treasure) is the only authenticated extant piece by Buddhist sculptor Jocho.
The principal image of Amitabha statue (National Treasure) is the only authenticated extant piece by Buddhist sculptor Jocho.
sen.cmt: 本尊 : the principal image ofを補足。
sen.e: The principal image of Amitabha statue (National Treasure) is the only authenticated extant piece by Buddhist sculptor Jocho.

sen.j: 本尊を安置する須弥壇は螺鈿（らでん）や飾金具で装飾され、周囲の扉や壁は極彩色の絵画で飾られ、天井や柱にも彩色文様が施されていた。
sen.e: The statue's platform is adorned with mother-of-pearl inlay work and metal ornaments, the surrounding doors and walls are decorated by richly colored paintings, and the ceiling and pillars are also covered with colorful patterns.
sen.cmt: ・mother-of-pearl inlay work: 新和英大辞典・metal ornament: 新和英大辞典・richy colored: 新和英大辞典
sen.e: The statue's platform is adorned with mother-of-pearl inlay work and metal ornaments, the surrounding doors and walls are decorated by richly colored paintings, and the ceiling and pillars are also covered with colorful patterns.

The statue's platform is adorned with mother-of-pearl inlay work and metal ornaments, the surrounding doors and walls are decorated by richly colored paintings, and the ceiling and pillars are also covered with colorful patterns.

sen.j: 長押（なげし）上の壁には楽器を奏で、舞いを舞う姿の供養菩薩像の浮き彫り（現存52体）があり、本尊の頭上には精巧な透かし彫りの天蓋（てんがい）を吊る。
sen.e: Relief carvings of celestials playing instruments and dancing (currently 52) have been applied to the wall above the non-penetrating tie beams, and an elaborate openwork canopy is suspended over the principal image.
sen.cmt: ・non-penetrating tie beams: http://www.aisf.or.jp/~jaanus・canopy: 新和英大辞典
sen.e: Relief carvings of Kuyo Bodhisattva playing instruments and dancing (currently 52) have been applied to the wall above the non-penetrating tie beams, and an elaborate openwork canopy is suspended over the principal image.
sen.cmt: 供養菩薩→ celestialsは該当しないと思います。菩薩はbodhisattva, Kuyo Bosatsuとしているサイトもあります。
sen.e: Relief carvings of Kuyo Bodhisattva playing instruments and dancing (currently 52) have been applied to the wall above the non-penetrating tie beams, and an elaborate openwork canopy is suspended over the principal image.

sen.j: 現在、壁画は剥落が激しく、柱や天井の装飾は色あせ、須弥壇の螺鈿は脱落しているが、創建当時の堂内は、当時の貴族が思い描いた極楽のイメージを再現した、華麗なものであったと思われる。
sen.e: The paintings are severely peeled, the colors on the pillars and ceiling have faded and the mother-of-pearl inlay work on the platform is damaged, but it is thought that, at the time of the temple's founding, the interior of the hall would have been a magnificent representation of how nobility imagined paradise to look.

The paintings are severely peeled, the colors on the pillars and ceiling have faded and the mother-of-pearl inlay work on the platform is damaged, but it is thought that, at the time of the temple's founding, the interior of the hall would have been a magnificent representation of how nobility imagined paradise to look.

The paintings are severely peeled, the colors on the pillars and ceiling have faded and the mother-of-pearl inlay work on the platform is damaged, but it is thought that, at the time of the temple's founding, the interior of the hall would have been a magnificent representation of how nobility imagined paradise to look.

sen.j: なお、「鳳凰堂」の呼称は江戸時代からで、当初は「阿弥陀堂」あるいは単に「御堂」と呼ばれていた。
sen.e: The name 'Ho-o-do' (Phoenix Hall) dates from the Edo period, but the building was originally named 'Amitabha Hall' or simply 'Mido'.
The name 'Ho-o-do' (Phoenix Hall) dates from the Edo period, but the building was originally named 'Amitabha Hall' or simply 'Mido.'
The name 'Ho-o-do' (Phoenix Hall) dates from the Edo period, but the building was originally named 'Amitabha Hall' or simply 'Mido.'

sen.j: 日本の十円硬貨には平等院鳳凰堂が、日本銀行券には鳳凰堂の屋根上に飾られている鳳凰がデザインされている。
sen.e: Byodo-in Temple's Ho-o-do hall is displayed on the Japanese 10 yen coin and Bank of Japan notes feature the Chinese Phoenix statues that adorn the roof of Ho-o-do hall.
Byodo-in Temple's Ho-o-do hall is displayed on the Japanese 10 yen coin and Bank of Japan notes feature the Chinese Phoenix statues that adorn the roof of Ho-o-do hall.
Byodo-in Temple's Ho-o-do hall is displayed on the Japanese 10 yen coin and Bank of Japan notes feature the Chinese Phoenix statues that adorn the roof of Ho-o-do hall.

sen.j: 庭園
sen.e: Gardens
Gardens
Gardens

sen.j: 中島に鳳凰堂の建つ阿字池を中心とした浄土式庭園。
sen.e: A Pure Land style garden centered around the Ajino-ike Pond within which Ho-o-do hall stands on an island.
A Pure Land style garden centered around the Ajino-ike Pond within which Ho-o-do hall stands on an island.
A Pure Land style garden centered around the Ajino-ike Pond within which Ho-o-do hall stands on an island.

sen.j: 平成2年（1990年）からの発掘調査により平安時代築造の州浜が検出され、現在は創建当初の姿に復元整備されている。
sen.e: Excavations that have been taking place since 1990 have unearthed sand used in Heian period construction and maintenance is currently underway to restore the building to how it would have been at the time of its construction.

Excavations that have been taking place since 1990 have unearthed sand used in Heian period construction and maintenance is currently underway to restore the building to how it would have been at the time of its construction.

Excavations that have been taking place since 1990 have unearthed sand used in Heian period construction and maintenance is currently underway to restore the building to how it would have been at the time of its construction.

sen.j: 鳳凰堂への入堂も池の北岸から2つの小橋を渡る当初の形式に復されている。
sen.e: The entrance to Ho-o-do hall is also being restored to the original crossing of two small bridges from the northern bank of the pond.
The entrance to Ho-o-do hall is also being restored to the original crossing of two small bridges from the northern bank of the pond.
The entrance to Ho-o-do hall is also being restored to the original crossing of two small bridges from the northern bank of the pond.

sen.j: 観音堂
sen.e: Kannon-do Hall
Kannon-do Hall
Kannon-do Hall

sen.j: 境内北側、表門を入って左側に建つ。
sen.e: Stands on the left as the grounds are entered through the main gate in the north.
Stands on the left as the grounds are entered through the main gate in the north.
Stands on the left as the grounds are entered through the main gate in the north.

sen.j: 本尊十一面観音立像（平安時代後期）を安置していたが、現在は鳳翔館に移されている。
sen.e: It originally housed the principal image standing statue of the Eleven-headed Kannon (dating from the latter part of the Heian period), but this has since been relocated to the Ho-sho-kan.
It originally housed the principal image standing statue of the Eleven-headed Kannon (dating from the latter part of the Heian period), but this has since been relocated to the Ho-sho-kan.
It originally housed the principal image standing statue of the Eleven-headed Kannon (dating from the latter part of the Heian period), but this has since been relocated to the Ho-sho-kan.

sen.j: 鳳翔館
sen.e: Ho-sho-kan
Ho-sho-kan

sen.j: 境内南側にある博物館で、2001年に開館した。
sen.e: This museum that stands in the south of the precinct was opened in 2001.
This museum that stands in the south of the precinct was opened in 2001.
This museum that stands in the south of the precinct was opened in 2001.

sen.j: 平等院鳳翔館の項を参照。
sen.e: Please refer to the article regarding the Byodo-in Temple Ho-sho-kan.
Please refer to the article regarding the Byodo-in Temple Ho-sho-kan.

sen.j: 鳳凰堂
sen.e: Ho-o-do hall

sen.j: 「伽藍」の節を参照
sen.e: Please refer to the 'Layout' section.

sen.j: 木造阿弥陀如来坐像
sen.e: Wooden sitting statue of Amitabha
Wooden sitting statue of Amitabha
Wooden sitting statue of Amitabha

sen.j: 仏師定朝の確証ある唯一の遺作。
sen.e: The only authenticated extant piece by Buddhist sculptor Jocho.
The only authenticated extant piece by Buddhist sculptor Jocho.
The only authenticated extant piece by Buddhist sculptor Jocho.

sen.j: 寄木造漆箔、像高284cm。
sen.e: The 284cm statue is assembled from separate pieces of wood and covered in gold leaf.
The 284cm statue is assembled from separate pieces of wood and covered in lacquer and gold leaf.
sen.cmt: 漆箔→漆を塗った上に金箔・銀箔を付ける技法です。
sen.e: The 284cm statue is assembled from separate pieces of wood and covered in lacquer and gold leaf.

sen.j: 定朝は和様彫刻様式の大成者、また寄木造技法の完成者として日本彫刻史上著名な仏師である。
sen.e: Jocho is a very well known Buddhist sculptor in the history of Japanese sculpture as a master of the wayo sculpture style and the individual who perfected the yosegi technique.
Jocho is a very well known Buddhist sculptor in the history of Japanese sculpture as a master of the wayo sculpture style and the individual who perfected the yosegi technique.

Jocho is a very well known Buddhist sculptor in the history of Japanese sculpture as a master of the 'wayo (Japanese)' sculpture style and the individual who perfected the 'yosegi (parquet)' technique.
sen.cmt: 「和様」「寄木造り」の意味を補足しました。

sen.j: 円満な面相、浅く流れる衣文などを特色とする定朝の優美で温和な作風は、「仏の本様」と称されて平安時代の貴族にもてはやされ、以後の仏像彫刻には定朝様（よう）が流行した。
sen.e: The elegant and gentle style exhibiting the contented face and the shallow flowing craftsmanship of the clothing at which Jocho excelled became known as 'the quintessential Buddhist style' and was highly praised among nobility, with the Jocho style becoming popular in later Buddhist statues.

The elegant and gentle style exhibiting the contented face and the shallow flowing craftsmanship of the clothing at which Jocho excelled became known as 'the quintessential Buddhist style' and was highly praised among nobility, with the Jocho style becoming popular in later Buddhist statues.

The elegant and gentle style exhibiting the contented face and the shallow flowing craftsmanship of the clothing at which Jocho excelled became known as 'the quintessential Buddhist style' and was highly praised among nobility, with the Jocho style becoming popular in later Buddhist statues.

sen.j: 定朝が制作した法成寺（藤原道長が建立した寺）などの仏像はことごとく失われ、晩年の作品である平等院像は、彼の作風を具体的に知ることのできる唯一の遺品として、きわめて貴重なものである。
sen.e: The works of Jocho that were kept at temples including Hojo-ji Temple (the temple constructed by FUJIWARA no Michinaga) have all been lost and the statue at Byodo-in Temple that he created in his last years is extremely valuable as the only extant piece that can be definitively verified as his work.

The works of Jocho that were kept at temples including Hojo-ji Temple (the temple constructed by FUJIWARA no Michinaga) have all been lost and the statue at Byodo-in Temple that he created in his last years is extremely valuable as the only extant piece that can be definitively verified as his work.

The works of Jocho that were kept at temples including Hojo-ji Temple (the temple constructed by FUJIWARA no Michinaga) have all been lost and the statue at Byodo-in Temple that he created in his last years is extremely valuable as the only extant piece that can be definitively verified as his work.

sen.j: 像内納入品の木板阿弥陀種子曼荼羅と木造蓮台は国宝の附（つけたり）指定となっている。
sen.e: Within the statue is a wooden board Amitabha-Shushi-Mandara and a wooden a lotus-shaped pedestal that have also been designated National Treasures along with the statue itself.
Within the statue is a wooden board Amitabha-Shushi-Mandara and a wooden a lotus-shaped pedestal that have also been designated National Treasures along with the statue itself.
Within the statue is a wooden board Amitabha-Shushi-Mandala and a wooden a lotus-shaped pedestal that have also been designated National Treasures along with the statue itself.

sen.j: 木造雲中供養菩薩像 52躯
sen.e: 52 wooden images of Unchu Kuyo Bodhisattva
52 wooden images of Unchu Kuyo Bodhisattva
52 wooden images of Unchu Kuyo Bodhisattva

sen.j: 鳳凰堂中堂の長押上の壁を飾る浮き彫りの菩薩像。
sen.e: These relief carvings of bodhisattva have been applied to the wall above the non-penetrating tie beams within the central hall of the Ho-o-do hall.
These relief carvings of bodhisattva have been applied to the wall above the non-penetrating tie beams within the central hall of the Ho-o-do hall.
These relief carvings of bodhisattva have been applied to the wall above the non-penetrating tie beams within the central hall of the Ho-o-do hall.

sen.j: 飛雲に乗り、阿弥陀如来とともに来迎する菩薩像を表わしたもので、52体（2008年に追加指定された1体を含む）が国宝に指定されている。
sen.e: The 52 (including one designated in 2008) images depicting the bodhisattva that ride flying clouds as they accompany Amitabha to Earth have been designated National Treasures.
The 52 (including one designated in 2008) images depicting the bodhisattva that ride flying clouds as they accompany Amitabha to Earth have been designated National Treasures.
The 52 (including one designated in 2008) images depicting the bodhisattva that ride flying clouds as they accompany Amitabha to Earth have been designated National Treasures.

sen.j: 各像のポーズは変化に富み、琴、琵琶、縦笛、横笛、笙、太鼓、鼓、鉦鼓などの楽器を奏する像が27体あり、他には合掌するもの、幡や蓮華などを持つもの、立って舞う姿のものなどがある。
sen.e: Each carving is in a different posture with some playing instruments such as koto, biwa, end-blown flutes, transverse flutes, free-reed instruments, drums, hand drums ad small gongs, and others putting their hands together in prayer, holding banners or lotus flowers or dancing.
sen.cmt: ・koto: 新和英大辞典・biwa: 新和英大辞典・end-blown flutes: 新和英大辞典・transverse flutes: 新和英大辞典・free-reed instruments: 新和英大辞典・hand drums: 新和英大辞典
sen.e: Each carving is in a different posture, and there are 27 carvings with some playing instruments such as koto, biwa, end-blown flutes, transverse flutes, free-reed instruments, drums, hand drums ad small gongs, and others putting their hands together in prayer, holding banners or lotus flowers or dancing.
sen.cmt: 27体あり、部分が抜けていました。
sen.e: Each carving is in a different posture, and there are 27 carvings with some playing instruments such as koto, biwa, end-blown flutes, transverse flutes, free-reed instruments, drums, hand drums ad small gongs, and others putting their hands together in prayer, holding banners or lotus flowers or dancing.

sen.j: 菩薩形の像が主だが、僧形の像も5体ある。
sen.e: The carvings mainly depict bodhisattva but there are five that depict Buddhist monks.
The carvings mainly depict bodhisattva but there are five that depict Buddhist monks.
The carvings mainly depict bodhisattva but there are five that depict Buddhist monks.

sen.j: 本尊阿弥陀如来像と同様、天喜元年（1053年）の作とされるが、補修はかなり多く、頭部が明治時代の修理で補作されているもの、像全体が鎌倉時代の補作であるものが各数体ある。
sen.e: As with the principal image of Amitabha, they are believed to have been created in 1053 but there have been numerous repairs with some having their heads repaired during the Meiji period and others having alterations made during the Kamakura period.

As with the principal image of Amitabha, they are believed to have been created in 1053 but there have been numerous repairs with some having their heads repaired during the Meiji period and others having alterations made during the Kamakura period.

As with the principal image of Amitabha, they are believed to have been created in 1053 but there have been numerous repairs with some having their heads repaired during the Meiji period and others having alterations made during the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 現存52体だが、当初全部で何体あったのかは定かでない。
sen.e: Currently 52 remain but it is not known how many existed at the time of the building's construction.
Currently 52 remain but it is not known how many existed at the time of the building's construction.
Currently 52 remain but it is not known how many existed at the time of the building's construction.

sen.j: 52体のうち半数の26体は鳳翔館に移されている。
sen.e: Of the 52, 26 have been relocated to the Ho-sho-kan.
Of the 52, 26 have been relocated to the Ho-sho-kan.
Of the 52, 26 have been relocated to the Ho-sho-kan.

sen.j: 中堂の扉10面、壁4面は、国宝建造物の一部であるとともに、そこに描かれた絵は絵画部門の国宝にも指定されている。
sen.e: The 10 door paintings and 4 wall paintings within the main hall are included as National Treasures along with the building itself but also have separate National Treasure designations as works of art.

The 10 door paintings and 4 wall paintings within the main hall are included as National Treasures along with the building itself but also have separate National Treasure designations as works of art.

The 10 door paintings and 4 wall paintings within the main hall are included as National Treasures along with the building itself but also have separate National Treasure designations as works of art.

sen.j: 主な主題は『観無量寿経』に基づく九品来迎図である。

The main work is that entitled 'Kuhon Raigo-zu', based on the "Contemplation Sutra."

sen.j: 以上のうち、北面壁、南面壁、本尊後壁（表裏）は当初は土壁で、壁画が描かれたのは鎌倉時代に下る。
sen.e: Of those above, the northern wall, southern wall and the wall behind the principal image (back face) were originally mud walls and the paintings were created after the Kamakura period.
Of those above, the northern wall, southern wall and the wall behind the principal image (back face) were originally mud walls and the paintings were created after the Kamakura period.
Of those above, the northern wall, southern wall and the wall behind the principal image (back face) were originally mud walls and the paintings were created after the Kamakura period.

sen.j: 扉絵は創建当初のものであるが、正面中央の2面の扉は、もっとも消耗が激しかったためか、江戸時代の寛文10年（1670年）の修理の際に取りかえた新しい扉になっており、国宝の14面には含まれない「附（つけたり）指定」となっている。
sen.e: The door paintings remain from the time of the temple's founding but, the front middle doors were replaced when repairs were made in 1670 during the Edo period as these two pieces were the most severely worn and they are therefore given an 'additional designation' not included in the 14 pieces that have been designated National Treasures.

The door paintings remain from the time of the temple's founding but, the front middle doors were replaced when repairs were made in 1670 during the Edo period as these two pieces were the most severely worn and they are therefore given an 'additional designation' not included in the 14 pieces that have been designated National Treasures.

The door paintings remain from the time of the temple's founding but, the front middle doors were replaced when repairs were made in 1670 during the Edo period as these two pieces were the most severely worn and they are therefore given an 'additional designation' not included in the 14 pieces that have been designated National Treasures.

sen.j: その他の画面も剥落がはげしく、画面には江戸時代末期の落書きも目立つが、平安時代後期 - 鎌倉時代の貴重な絵画遺品である。
sen.e: Other images are severely peeled and display conspicuous graffiti dating from the end of the Edo period, but they remain valuable remnants of late-Heian period-Kamakura period artwork.
Other images are severely peeled and display conspicuous graffiti dating from the end of the Edo period, but they remain valuable remnants of late-Heian period-Kamakura period artwork.
Other images are severely peeled and display conspicuous graffiti dating from the end of the Edo period, but they remain valuable remnants of late-Heian period-Kamakura period artwork.

sen.j: なお、正面と南北側面のオリジナルの扉は取り外して宝物館に収められており、代わりに復元模写の扉がはめられている。
sen.e: The original doors from the front, north and south have been removed, deposited in the 'Homotsu-kan' (treasure hall) and replaced by replicas.
The original doors from the front, north and south have been removed, deposited in the 'Homotsu-kan' (treasure hall) and replaced by replicas.
sen.cmt: Homotsu-kan'の前のスペースを調整。
sen.e: The original doors from the front, north and south have been removed, deposited in the 'Homotsu-kan' (treasure hall) and replaced by replicas.

sen.j: 木造天蓋
sen.e: Wooden Canopy
Wooden Canopy
Wooden Canopy

sen.j: 本尊阿弥陀如来像の頭上に吊られた木造天蓋で、像とは別個に、彫刻部門の国宝に指定されている。
sen.e: The wooden canopy that is suspended above the head of the main statue of Amitabha has been designated a National Treasure as a carving separately from the statue.
The wooden canopy that is suspended above the head of the main statue of Amitabha has been designated a National Treasure as a carving separately from the statue.
The wooden canopy that is suspended above the head of the main statue of Amitabha has been designated a National Treasure as a carving separately from the statue.

sen.j: 折上小組格天井形の方蓋と、その内側に吊る円蓋からなり、透彫と螺鈿で装飾されている。
sen.e: Composed of the outer coved, coffered, finely latticed ceiling and the inner layer suspended within, and decorated with openwork and mother-of-pearl inlay work.
Composed of the outer coved, coffered, finely latticed ceiling and the inner layer suspended within, and decorated with openwork and mother-of-pearl inlay work.
Composed of the outer coved, coffered, finely latticed ceiling and the dome-shaped inner layer suspended within, and decorated with openwork and mother-of-pearl inlay work.

sen.j: 金銅鳳凰1対
sen.e: Pair of Guilt-Bronze Chinese Phoenixes
Pair of Gold-Bronze Chinese Phoenixes
Pair of Gold-Bronze Chinese Phoenixes

sen.j: もと鳳凰堂の屋根上にあったもので、鳳翔館に収蔵されている（現在、屋根上にある鳳凰は複製）。
sen.e: These originally crowned the roof of the Ho-o-do hall but are now stored within the Ho-sho-kan.
These originally crowned the roof of the Ho-o-do hall but are now stored within the Ho-sho-kan (the ones on the roof are replicas).
sen.cmt: （現在、屋根上にある鳳凰は複製）、部分が抜けていました。
sen.e: These originally crowned the roof of the Ho-o-do hall but are now stored within the Ho-sho-kan (the ones on the roof are replicas).

sen.j: 高さ約2.3メートルで、くちばしから尾羽に至るまで精巧に作られている。
sen.e: They stand at approximately 2.3m tall and have been exquisitely crafted from beak to tail.
They stand at approximately 2.3m tall and have been exquisitely crafted from beak to tail.
They stand at approximately 2.3m tall and have been exquisitely crafted from beak to tail.

sen.j: 工芸品部門の国宝に指定されている。
sen.e: They are designated National Treasures as crafts.
They are designated National Treasures as crafts.
They are designated National Treasures as crafts.

sen.j: 梵鐘
sen.e: Bell
Bell
Bell

sen.j: 鳳凰堂と同じ11世紀頃の制作と推定される。
sen.e: As with the Ho-o-do hall, it is estimated to have been cast in the 11th century.
As with the Ho-o-do hall, it is estimated to have been cast in the 11th century.
As with the Ho-o-do hall, it is estimated to have been cast in the 11th century.

sen.j: 全面に天人、獅子、唐草文様などの繊細な浮き彫りを施した、他に例を見ない鐘である。
sen.e: This entire surface of this unique bell is adorned with intricate carvings depicting imagery such as heavenly beings, lions and arabesque patterns.
This entire surface of this unique bell is adorned with intricate carvings depicting imagery such as heavenly beings, lions and arabesque patterns.
This entire surface of this unique bell is adorned with intricate carvings depicting imagery such as heavenly beings, lions and arabesque patterns.

sen.j: 「音の三井寺」、「銘の神護寺」、「姿、形の平等院」と謳われ、神護寺、園城寺（三井寺）の鐘とともに、「天下の三名鐘」に数えられている。
sen.e: The bell is celebrated for its form, and is counted among the top three bells in the country along with that of Jingo-ji Temple celebrated for its inscriptions and that of Mii-dera Temple celebrated for its sound.

The bell is celebrated for its form, and is counted among 'the top three bells' in the country along with that of Jingo-ji Temple celebrated for its inscriptions and that of Enjyo-ji Temple (Mii-dera Temple) celebrated for its sound.
sen.cmt: 原文に比べやや意訳気味なため、園城寺のみ補足し、全体はそのままにしています。
sen.e: The bell is celebrated for its form, and is counted among 'the top three bells' in the country along with that of Jingo-ji Temple celebrated for its inscriptions and that of Onjo-ji Temple (Mii-dera Temple) celebrated for its sound.

sen.j: 現在鐘楼にある梵鐘は複製で、実物は鳳翔館に収蔵されている。
sen.e: The bell currently in the belfry is a replica, with the original being kept at the Ho-sho-kan.
The bell currently in the belfry is a replica, with the original being kept at the Ho-sho-kan.
The bell currently in the belfry is a replica, with the original being kept at the Ho-sho-kan.

sen.j: この梵鐘は1980年11月25日発行の60円切手のデザインにも採用されている（2006年現在も利用可能だが、販売は2002年に停止）。
sen.e: The belfry was used on the design for the 60-yen postage stamp issued on November 25th, 1980 (could still be used as of 2006 but no longer sold since 2002).
The belfry was used on the design for the 60-yen postage stamp issued on November 25th, 1980 (could still be used as of 2006 but no longer sold since 2002).
The belfry was used on the design for the 60-yen postage stamp issued on November 25th, 1980 (could still be used as of 2006 but no longer sold since 2002).

sen.j: 観音堂
sen.e: Kannon-do Hall
Kannon-do Hall
Kannon-do Hall

sen.j: 木造十一面観音立像
sen.e: Wooden standing statue of the Eleven-headed Kannon
Wooden standing statue of the Eleven-headed Kannon
Wooden standing statue of the Eleven-headed Kannon

sen.j: 養林庵書院 - 山内寺院の浄土院に建つ。
sen.e: Yorinan Shoin study room: At Jodo-in Temple that stands within the temple precinct.
Yorinan Shoin study room: At Jodo-in Temple that stands within the temple precinct.
Yorinan Shoin study room: At Jodo-in Temple that stands within the temple precinct.

sen.j: 非公開。
sen.e: Not open to the public.
Not open to the public.
Not open to the public.

sen.j: 平等院庭園（1922年（大正11年）3月8日に史跡・名勝に指定）
sen.e: Byodo-in Temple Gardens (Designated a Historic Site/Place of Scenic Beauty on March 8th, 1922)
Byodo-in Temple Gardens (Designated a Historic Site/Place of Scenic Beauty on March 8, 1922)
Byodo-in Temple Gardens (Designated a Historic Site/Place of Scenic Beauty on March 8, 1922)

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道 奈良線「宇治駅 (JR西日本)」下車 東へ徒歩10分
sen.e: 10 minutes walk from 'Uji station (West JR)' on the West Japan Railway Company Nara Line
10 minutes walk to the east from 'Uji station (West JR)' on the West Japan Railway Company Nara Line
10 minutes walk to the east from 'Uji station (West JR)' on the West Japan Railway Company Nara Line

sen.j: 京阪電気鉄道 京阪宇治線「宇治駅 (京阪)」下車 徒歩10分
sen.e: 10 minutes walk from 'Uji station (Keihan)' on the Keihan Electric Railway Keihan Uji Line
